FuncDef:
The remark dscp command configures an action of re-marking the DSCP priority in IP packets in a traffic behavior.
The undo remark dscp command deletes the configuration. The remark dscp command configures an action of re-marking the DSCP priority in IP packets in a traffic behavior. The undo remark dscp command deletes the configuration. By default, an action of re-marking the DSCP priority in IP packets is not configured in a traffic behavior.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the DSCP priority in IP packets.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 63. A larger value indicates a higher priority.

Specifies the DSCP priority name in IP packets.
The value can be ef, af11, af12, af13, af21, af22, af23, af31, af32, af33, af41, af42, af43, cs1, cs2, cs3, cs4, cs5, cs6, cs7, or default.

ExtraInfo: To provide differentiated services based on the DSCP priority, run the remark dscp command to configure the device to re-mark the DSCP priority in IP packets in a traffic behavior.
